text: Abula is a soup of Yoruba people from Western Nigeria. It is typically eaten together with Amala, but can be eaten with other swallow foods. Abula is a mixture of Gbegiri (Bean soup), Ewedu (draw vegetable soup) and obe ata (stew). ==See also== * List of soups ==References== Category:African soups Category:Nigerian cuisine Category:Igbo cuisine Category:Yoruba cuisine
title: Abula (soup)
